Items.Title: Roll Call
Invocation
Items.AgendaNote:
INVOCATION - Delivered by: Pastor Roderick Caesar III and Bishop Dr. Roderick Caesar, serving as spiritual leaders at Bethel Gospel Tabernacle, located at 110-25 Guy Brewer Blvd, Jamaica, NY, 11433.

Motion to spread the Invocation in full upon the record by Council Member Adams.
Items.MinutesNote:
The Invocation was delivered by Pastor Roderick Caesar III and Bishop Dr. Roderick Caesar, serving as spiritual leaders at Bethel Gospel Tabernacle, located at 110-25 Guy Brewer Blvd, Jamaica, NY, 11433.

Council Member Adams moved to spread the Invocation in full upon the Record.

Items.Title: Adoption of Minutes
Items.AgendaNote: ADOPTION OF MINUTES - Motion that the Minutes of the Stated Meeting of September 23, 2020 be adopted as printed by Council Member Louis.
Items.MinutesNote: Council Member Louis moved that the Minutes of the Stated Meeting of September 23, 2020 be adopted as printed.

Items.Title: Messages & Papers from the Mayor

Communication from the Mayor - Submitting the name of Kenseth Armstead to the Council for its advice and consent regarding his appointment as a member of the New York City Art Commission, known as the Public Design Commission, pursuant to Sections 31 and 851 of the New York City Charter.
Items.ActionText: This Mayor's Message was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Rules, Privileges and Elections
Items.MatterName: Kenseth Armstead, appointment as a member of the NYC Art Commission, known as the Public Design Commission.

Items.Title: Communication from the Mayor - Submitting the name of Deborah Marton to the Council for its advice and consent regarding her appointment as a member of the New York City Art Commission, known as the Public Design Commission, pursuant to Sections 31 and 851 of the New York City Charter.
Items.ActionText: This Mayor's Message was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Rules, Privileges and Elections
Items.MatterName: Deborah Marton, appointment as a member of the NYC Art Commission, known as the Public Design Commission.

Items.Title: General Discussion
Extension of Remarks
INTRODUCTION AND READING OF BILLS

A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to prohibiting the police department from collecting DNA from a minor without consent from a parent, legal guardian or attorney
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Public Safety
Items.MatterName: Prohibiting the police department from collecting DNA from a minor without consent from a parent, legal guardian or attorney.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to changing the amount of public matching funds available for the election cycle ending in 2021, and the repeal thereof
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Governmental Operations
Items.MatterName: Changing the amount of public matching funds available for the election cycle ending in 2021, and the repeal thereof.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to requiring a clause in commercial leases that obligates the parties to engage in good faith negotiations during certain states of emergency.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Small Business
Items.MatterName: Requiring a clause in commercial leases that obligates the parties to engage in good faith negotiations during certain states of emergency.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the State Legislature to pass, and the Governor to sign, S.5324, which would eliminate the cap on assessment increases for Class 1 dwellings valued at more than $3,000,000 where the owners have a gross household income not exceeding $250,000.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Finance
Items.MatterName: Eliminate the cap on assessment increases for Class 1 dwellings valued at more than $3,000,000 where the owners have a gross household income not exceeding $250,000. (S.5324)

Items.MinutesNote:
The presence of a quorum was announced by The Public Advocate (Mr. Williams).


There were 49 Council Members marked present for this virtual Stated Meeting.


At the time of this virtual Stated Meeting, there were two vacant Council seats:
37th District (Brooklyn) and 12th District (The Bronx).
At this point the Speaker (Council Member Johnson) made the following annoucements:

Whereupon on motion of the Speaker (Council Member Johnson), the Majority Leader and Acting President Pro Tempore (Council Member Cumbo)  adjourned to meet again on Thursday, October 29, 2020.

MICHAEL McSWEENEY, City Clerk
Clerk of the Council

Items.Title: Application No. 20215006 HAM (505 West 134th Street Cluster) submitted by the New York City Department of Housing Preservation and Development pursuant to Article 16 of the General Municipal Law and Article XI of the Private Housing Finance Law, requesting the waiver of the area designation requirements of Section 693 of the General Municipal Law and Sections 197-c and 197-d of the Charter, approval of an urban development action area project, and approval of an exemption from real property taxes for property located at 505 West 134th Street (Block 1988, Lot 27), 523 West 134th Street (Block 1988, Lot 12), and 527 West 134th Street (Block 1988, Lot 8), Borough of Manhattan, Community District 9.
Items.ActionText: This Land Use Application was Referred to Comm by Council to the Subcommittee on Landmarks, Public Sitings and Dispositions
Items.MatterName: Landmarks, 505 West 134th Street Cluster, Manhattan (20215006)

Items.Title: Application No. C 200103 ZMQ (110-40 Saultell Avenue Rezoning) submitted by Tuchman Associates, LLC, pursuant to Sections 197-c and 201 of the New York City Charter for an amendment of the Zoning Map, Section No. 10b, changing from an R6B District to an R6 District, Borough of Queens, Council District 21, Community District 4.
Items.ActionText: This Land Use Application was Referred to Comm by Council to the Subcommittee on Zoning and Franchises
Items.MatterName: Zoning, 110-40 Saultell Avenue Rezoning, Queens (C 200103 ZMQ)

Items.Title: Application No. N 200104 ZRQ (110-40 Saultell Avenue Rezoning) submitted by Tuchman Associates, LLC, pursuant to Section 201 of the New York City Charter, for an amendment of the Zoning Resolution of the City of New York, modifying Appendix F for the purpose of establishing a Mandatory Inclusionary Housing area, Borough of Queens, Council District 21, Community District 4.
Items.ActionText: This Land Use Application was Referred to Comm by Council to the Subcommittee on Zoning and Franchises
Items.MatterName: Zoning, 110-40 Saultell Avenue Rezoning, Queens (N 200104 ZRQ)

Items.MinutesNote: The Majority Leader and Acting President Pro Tempore (Council Member Cumbo) put the question whether the Council would agree with and adopt such reports, which were decided in the affirmative by the following vote:

The following files were removed from the General Order Calendar and voted separately:

M-255 & Res. No. 1467.  45-4-0 - Negative: CMs Borelli, Holden, Ulrich, and the Minority Leader (Council Member Matteo)

M-256 & Res. No. 1468,  48-1-0 - Negative: CM Van Bramer.

Int. No. 2093,  47-2-0 - Negative: Borelli and the Minority Leader (Council Member Matteo).

Int. No. 2127-A,  46-2-1 - Negative: CMs Holden and Yeger.  Abstain: CM Miller.

L.U. No. 670 & Res. No. 1451,  48-1-0 - Negative: CM Barron.

L.U. No. 674 & Res. No. 1455, L.U. No. 675 & Res. No. 1456, L.U. No. 676 & Res. No. 1457and L.U. No. 677 & Res. No. 1458 (all Filed pursuant to a Letter of Withdrawal)   48-1-0 - Negative: CM Deutsch.

L.U. 678 & Res 1459,  46-3-0 - Negative:  CMs Barron, Deutsch, and Reynoso.

L.U. 679 & Res 1460,  47-2-0 - Negative: CMs Barron and Reynoso.

See files for individual votes.

Items.Title: Passed The Consent Agenda
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that these files be approved by consent vote.
